word:
[J. N. Andrews] would go out into the field with his oxen, and as he drove them, he would refer to his book, and read a few words or sentences, and then repeat these in full, loud tones in order to exercise his lungs, as well as to impress the words and sentences upon his memory.--Manuscript 91, 1903. ("Self-Improvement," Address at Teachers' Institute, August 20, 1903.) 


                                     -436-
